stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Elysium
[Gender] Male
[Combat Experience] 2 Years
[Place of Birth] Iberia
[Date of Birth] May 8
[Race] Liberi
[Height] 187cm
[Infection Status] 
Crystals have appeared on his body. Infection confirmed by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Elysium, a Rhodes Island Operator from Iberia, mastered a rather unique form of voice-related Originium Arts. Caught trying to fill in 'Once in a lifetime hottie' on his resume profile, he was detained on the spot by members of the HR Department. 
Now deputy leader of the 3rd Special Operations Squad, Elysium is responsible for maintaining clear channels of communication on the battlefield and assisting squad members in covert operations.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of his internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in his circulatory system, confirming him to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 7%
A small amount of Originium crystals are present on the surface of Elysium's body. He emphatically claims that they are there for decoration, but how could anyone choose to adorn themselves so tastelessly? 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.21u/L
The current condition is stable, and effective results have been obtained through focal treatment. Follow-up treatment should be adjusted appropriately depending on the patient's actual condition. 

Elysium's condition has always been stable. Perhaps this is related to his confident, over-the-top optimism? I don't necessarily hate guys like him, but he does get on my nerves every now and then. 
—Gavial

Although Elysium has always proclaimed that there is no way he could have been born in Iberia, he shares the characteristics of unfettered boldness and unrestrained freedom that are so prominent in that area. 
Elysium has traveled the corners of the world alone, and has been to just about any place that you or I could name, including the kind of forlorn places that his codename suggests. According to his own account, he did consider becoming a messenger prior to joining Rhodes Island, a career plan that is now on hold. 
In fact, Elysium's sense of direction is so strong that he can remember any place he's ever been to, as well as being able to mentally map out a course of action with surprising accuracy. However, the maps that he comes up with often are not cost-efficient or practical, and he sometimes has to simplify these routes to facilitate better understanding and realizability — and yet, none of this meticulousness is carried over to his daily life.

Due to Elysium's unique utility, he is often transferred between various teams due to what the task requires. 
Generally speaking, in addition to facilitating communication within the team, Elysium's most frequent job is to coordinate interpersonal relationships and arbitrate conflict. He values the relationships between team members far more than Operators who prefer to work alone; therefore, any conflict between members is the last thing he wants to see. 
Elysium's mere presence during a mission is enough to improve a team's morale and facilitate a more relaxed atmosphere. Though he often fails to recognize his own contribution in maintaining the harmony of a team, he always manages to elicit some very memorable reactions. When operators with clashing personalities have to be assigned to the same team due to special circumstances, the operation leader will often consider adding Elysium to keep the operation moving forward smoothly.

'Elysium and I joined at roughly the same time, so I know a few things about him. 
There might be people out there who are inclined to believe that he doesn't work hard or take his responsibilities seriously because of his somewhat irreverent, joking tone. 
But we've all come to realize that this is but another form of humility. A Special Ops team's line of work can be very dangerous, and Elysium's role during these operations is sometimes even more important. The transmission device he carries with him needs to be paired with his Originium Arts in order to achieve the greatest effect, and the tacit synergy between Elysium and his direct superior can sometimes be the key to victory. 
To say that his job is to provide courage itself is, in my opinion, not an exaggeration. But this courage is not the flag-waving kind that gets people riled up before they charge off to war, but rather something more practical. 
When operators such as Elysium are present on the battlefield, the commander can better focus on understanding the overall situation, and individual operators can fight with the peace of mind that the operation plan is being executed. Some special operations even hinge on the state.' 
—Dobermann

Elysium has his own unique criteria for determining whether someone is trustworthy. 
In the entirety of Rhodes Island, the person who Elysium trusts most is the leader of the 3rd Squad to which he is also assigned, and these sentiments are reciprocated. It can be said that the duo's unbreakable trust is a product of their ability to fit together in all aspects, as well as years of cultivating their relationship. 
As the captain of one of Rhodes Island's special squads, the leader has a very special ability. This ability often provides unexpected and valuable effects in combat, but poses a hindrance in daily life. Only through Elysium's assistance is the leader able to normally communicate with others, and this responsibility may perhaps be the reason why Elysium chose to stay in Rhodes Island. 

'Even though it seems like he's always getting smacked around, they're actually on very good terms.' 
'Smacked around? Is the leader of the 3rd Squad such a vicious person?' 
'Hmm, I wouldn't say that. The leader's actually an introverted person, despite trying to maintain a cool and calm appearance... Whatever happens, it's usually because Elysium is such a pain in the ass!' 
—Conversation between a member of the 3rd Squad and a member of the HR Department

Once Elysium has recognized someone as reliable, he will display his trust in his own special way, which may manifest in the form of nonsensical dialogue, or through increasingly preposterous bets. In this regard, 'comrade' has a very special meaning for Elysium, and this is not a term that he uses lightly. 
Taking everything in consideration, none can deny that Elysium is an excellent teammate and a reliable partner on the battlefield, even if he can be a bit annoying.

How high does he want to get promoted? 
If that position would put him above the squad's captain, Elysium would turn down that opportunity.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.
<color name=#ffffff>MARTHE [Coral Coast] Shining Dew Series SDm11 for men. Tight-fitting, lightweight, breathable, and designed for the summer.</color>

One of Elysium's Numerous Outfits as a Messenger/Snowy Echo. Many associate the pairing of red and white with the bygone Icefield Messenger. Perhaps to pander to their expectations, he's matched it with a pair of spectacles on purpose.

skills.desc: Stops attacking and recovers <@ba.vup>{value}</> DP over the skill duration

Stops attacking and recovers <@ba.vup>{value}</> DP over the skill duration. While this skill is active, Locks up to <@ba.vup>{max_target}</> nearby enemies.
Locked enemies have <@ba.vup>-{-move_speed:0%}</> Movement Speed, <@ba.vup>-{-def:0%}</> DEF, and lose <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</>

modules.desc:
Operator Elysium has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for raising allied morale in the field.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Vanguard Operator during field operations to exercise Standard Bearer responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Call Log 012-1177
'Hello? You there? I'm in big trouble!'
'What's up? Someone bust your head open?'
'Even worse!!!'
'Where are you?'
'The usual place...'

Call Log 013-1177
'Calling back so soon? Something happen?'
'[PROLONGED LAUGHTER]'
'......'
'Sorry, I gotta laugh a little longer—[LAUGHTER]'
'...Quit it! This is life or death to me!
'Just—okay, I owe you! If we can get this all properly sorted, I'll treat you to the best stuff!'
'Sure.
'Whatcha want me to do?'
'First—don't tell anybody about this!'

Call Log 025-1177
'Stuff's here.'
'Phew! Great, now bring it over!'
'You've been holed up in there for three days now.
'Medical's people are worried about you. Got any excuses I can still feed them?'
'Trust me, I've got a good feeling about this. This'll all work out, guaranteed!
'This little treasure comes from a Higashinese salon! Takes effect lightning fast, pushes rewind on even the worst cases, apparently! Tons of good reviews online too!'

Call Log 028-1177
'How is it?'
'...Don't think it's doing anything.
'You think I should turn the temperature up a little more? Or maybe give it a few more hours?'
'You got duped again. Just knock it off already, it's like a bad comedy routine.
'I'm gonna go fetch a Medic to sort your troubles out.'
'Wait, don't, don't go—'
'Did you run dry? I thought you'd throw out even more of your promises to get me to stop.'
'......'
'Hello? You still there?'

Call Log 273-1000
...go.
'Is that... you, captain?'
...sistance.
'...Is this an SOS?
'Your signal's a little weak. I even have the amplifier on.
'Please repeat instructions.'
Sendi... coordin...
'Coordinates?
'...Coordinates received.
'I'm heading out now!'

Call Log 029-1177
'Elysium? Where are you?'
'An emergency call came in. I've gotta run this mission first.'
'Huh? Don't you have, uh, something else weighing on your head?'
'Don't remind me!!'

Call Log 277-1000
...Every base station's been destroyed. You're the last one.
Thanks to you, reinforcements arrived with time to spare.
Didn't think you'd still be carrying that thing.
'You mean this pager-receiver? Should've been decommissioned forever ago, you're right. [LAUGHTER] I was just... rummaging through some old stuff at the time.'
Uh-huh.
By the way, your hair—your 'lightning bolt' do, is that the new thing?
People keep laughing the moment they see you. I think everyone likes it.
'No, no, listen, it was an accident!!!'

missionList.desc: During battle, have Elysium use Support γ a total of 10 times (excluding Support Units)
Clear Main Theme S3-6 with a 3-star rating; You must deploy your own Elysium, and cannot include any other Vanguard Operators as members

voice_lines.voiceText: Feel free to assign any work to me. I have a lot of experience as a second-in-command.

This communicator transmits signals over long distances, it's a powerful tool for keeping teams in touch. My Arts even amplify the signal, ensuring that communication between teams goes unimpeded. Honestly, battlefield communication is a job that was practically made for me.

Lost? No worries, tell me where you wanna go. Um, to get there, first go up the stairs on the left until you reach the fourth floor. Then turn right, and after passing the third fork, make a left. Go down a floor, then proceed to your left. It's directly across from Closure's #3 Engineering Room. How's that? Aren't my instructions clear and concise?

Thorns and I have reached an agreement: Next time, neither of us will hold back, and a victor will be crowned. I'll be sure to defeat him by a landside... What? Rhodes Island has an explicit ban on personal fights? You misunderstand, I'm only talking about chess. Loser has to shave his head, what say you to this bet?

To be honest, I'm not used to being someone else's assistant. But since my captain relies solely on me to deliver her orders, I have to stay on the squad to support her. Oh, that's just between you and me, by the way. For both our sakes, don't ever tell her what I just told you, okay?

There's no overstating the importance of communication on the battlefield. And of course, the one facilitating it is the first to get targeted. But don't worry, as long as I'm here, I'll make sure your orders are smoothly transmitted to all combat personnel.

Doctor, you came right on time. Actually, there's something bothering me. Why does everyone prefer looking at a map over asking me for directions? The captain says my glib tone gets on people's nerves. But that can't be, I always treat everyone with perfect kindness, wouldn't you agree?

On the battlefield, few things are more important than morale. Do you see this banner? As a vanguard, just lifting it is enough to fill everyone with courage. Wait, Doctor, you didn't seriously believe that, did you? I was just joking, this thing's actually a communication device.

Doctor, you've earned my trust. There's no need to be so humble. I know I'm a good judge of character. How about I call you my comrade-in-arms from now on? My captain and I used to be like oil and water, but look at us now. I believe that, much like her, you will eventually be moved by my sincerity. No? The captain sent you a letter complaining about me? What?
Doctor, the files over here are... Hm? Already asleep? Well, even if it's just me, you really shouldn't let your guard down like that.
3rd Combat Squad, vanguard and communications specialist, Elysium, reporting in. We've always communicated through electronic means, I do believe this is our first time speaking face-to-face, Doctor?
I'm seeing myself in a lot of these battle records. Talk about weird.
Thank you very much. I won't end up ranked higher than my captain if I get promoted again, will I?
I've always trusted my own judgment, Doctor. But if you're the one giving me orders, I won't question them for a second. After all, isn't that what it means to be a comrade-in-arms?
Of course, I'd love to.
Don't worry, I'm just a stand-in. The captain's not here right now, after all.
Let's go then. Everyone, follow the route I drafted.
Check your headsets, people.
No problem.
Signal stable. Ready for action.
I wonder who their target will be.
Gather under this banner in the name of the Lord— Heh, I've always wanted to try saying that.
Sorry, but I'm really not religious.
Who would! Use a flag! As a weapon on the battlefield!
Now we'll see them!
Let's get this done quick!
This just confirms it. We really do make the best partners.
Great teamwork. Give me five!
If they've lost their fighting spirit, they're not our enemies anymore. Let's stop here.
It's too dangerous! I'll be the last line of defense! Doctor, please give the order to retreat!
Hm... Has this room been renovated?
What's up?
I've heard that if this tuft of red hair on my head falls out, it won't ever grow back. This is a very serious problem, Doctor.
Arknights.

Hello, hello? Can you hear me...? Signal's fine, connection to the landship's all clear. Doctor, try to guess which comms station I'm calling from...? Doc's distracted! Now! Set off the fireworks! Heh-heh, what do you think, Doctor? Now that's a passionate New Year's celebration, isn't it?
Hey, Doctor! Got any missions for me today?

Happy birthday, Doctor. I've meticulously prepared this year's gift, taking into consideration everything I've learned. This time, you'll be blown away by... W-Wait, hold on, Doctor, don't leave! I swear, it's not a prank this time!

Rhodes Island's a lot busier now than when I first arrived. We keep finding more and more trustworthy companions, and I think I'm not the only one drawing complaints anymore. I'm deeply moved, so I painstakingly edited up an audio reel of everyone being drunk at last year's party! I hope it gets some enthusiastic reactions!

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Reception Room, increases the likelihood of obtaining <@cc.kw>Rhodes Island</> clues (Rate is influenced by length of work time)

When this Operator is assigned to the Reception Room, every time that a non-<@cc.kw>Rhodes Island</> clue is collected, increases the likelihood of obtaining <@cc.kw>Rhodes Island</> clues (Rate is influenced by length of work time)
